content.rendered:
I’ve picked up several different art supplies over the years, thinking that I would be able to use them for one thing or another.

I picked up clay, thinking I would come up with all sorts of wonderful creations. I even imagined me making an elephant but my creations never got beyond the imagination stage.

I got pencils, colored pencils and pencils that are watercolors. I even got a fancy coloring book, but I’ve hardly used any of them.

I got watercolors and I’ve not used them at all. It’s not that I don’t enjoy watercolors or know how to use them. I do know how to use them. It just seems that I haven’t found the occasion to use them.

I’ve even picked up several art pads and notebooks. One of them has been making a handy pad for my phone. But most of the art pads sit in a stack, unused and hardly touched.

There is one arts and craft item that I have been enjoying, and it is the least expensive of all: that is Play-Doh. I really like the texture and the smell. I don’t have to make anything special out of it and, when I’m done, I can put it right back in it’s container.

Sometimes, the best art supplies aren’t the fanciest or the most expensive. They say that the best camera is the one that you carry around with you. And I find Play-Doh works for me. What craft or crafts do you enjoy most? Please comment below.
